data.title: Tricks Of The Mind To Tell The Trickster From The Sage
data.meta_description: The charlatan comes in many shades of colour. The huckster wears many hats. Shyster, swindler, svengali — they have always been with us and always will. Scrolling through my feed on Facebook, I often…
data.text:
The charlatan comes in many shades of colour. The huckster wears many hats. Shyster, swindler, svengali — they have always been with us and always will.

One of the modern incarnations of this ancient art is the internet business guru.

Scrolling through my feed on Facebook, I often come upon what seem like perfectly ordinary people waxing lyrical about how they make five, or even six figures if they’re particularly brazen and gone a bit bananas, a month usually doing something that sounds a bit vague and would make little sense to someone even back in the nineties.

The pitch will go something like: ‘I’m no writer but I make five figures on Amazon every month by … .’

Or they’ll say something about affiliate marketing and 5 or 6 figures.

Or leveraging something or other and the necessary number of figures.

Or lowcontent books on Amazon.

Or financial something and those purty little figures.
